notes: Second generation R56 Cooper continued through 2013 with revised N16 engine featuring improved fuel economy and emissions. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Hatch article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation R56 Cooper S received N18 engine update with increased power output and improved reliability over N14. Turbocharger with direct injection requires boost pressure diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Hatch article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation convertible based on R56 platform. Power soft top mechanism requires specialized diagnostic tools. Available in Cooper and Cooper S variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Convertible article, January 2025 revision.

Extended wheelbase wagon continued with updated N16/N18 engines. Distinctive split rear 'Clubdoor' hinge mechanisms require specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Clubman article, January 2025 revision.

First crossover Mini with optional ALL4 AWD system using electromagnetic multi-plate clutch. Increased ground clearance and UKL1 platform shared with second-gen BMW X1. ALL4 system requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Countryman article, January 2025 revision.

Fixed-roof coupe variant based on R56 platform. John Cooper Works (JCW) variant features upgraded turbo and tuning. Lower roofline and different aerodynamics compared to standard hatchback. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Coupe article, January 2025 revision.

Convertible variant of R58 Coupe with power soft top. Manual top mechanism simpler than R52/R57 but still requires specific service procedures. John Cooper Works variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Roadster article, January 2025 revision.

Three-door coupe-crossover variant based on R60 Countryman platform. Optional ALL4 AWD system with electromagnetic multi-plate clutch. Discontinued after single generation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Paceman article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation F56 Cooper introduced BMW B-series modular 3-cylinder turbo engine with TwinPower Turbo technology. UKL2 platform shared with BMW 2 Series Active Tourer. 7-speed DCT requires specialized transmission service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Hatch article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation F56 Cooper S features BMW B48 2.0L turbo 4-cylinder with TwinPower Turbo. Increased power and improved fuel economy over previous generation. DCT transmission requires specialized diagnostics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Hatch article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation convertible based on F56 platform with BMW B-series engines. Power soft top mechanism requires specialized diagnostic tools. Available in Cooper and Cooper S variants. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Convertible article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation Clubman significantly larger with traditional rear doors instead of split 'Clubdoors'. UKL2 platform, optional ALL4 AWD with electromagnetic multi-plate clutch. 8-speed automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Clubman article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation Countryman on UKL2 platform with increased size. Optional ALL4 AWD system with electromagnetic multi-plate clutch. Available with BMW B-series 3-cylinder and 4-cylinder turbo engines. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mini Countryman article, January 2025 revision.
